alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 11:01PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Carbon County through 1145 PM MDT... At 1100 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Teton Reservoir to 6 miles northeast of Hog Park Reservoir. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Teton Reservoir around 1110 PM MDT. Rawlins around 1125 PM MDT. Saratoga around 1130 PM MDT. Separation Lake around 1140 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Riverside and Slater. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 200 and 244. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
